div.p: Greetings. I did not want, reverend father in Christ, for our Gesner, who came here to collect his debts, to return to you empty-handed, especially since the opportunity to meet certain people does not always present itself. And first of all, as I should, I congratulate you not so much in my own name but in the name of all those who are even moderately acquainted with your pious labors, for the good health you enjoy in your advanced, yet still vigorous and healthy old age. I pray to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, in whose ministry you have lived for 40 years with great praise and also for the benefit of the church, that He may continue to keep you safe for us to the glory of His name.
